alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 10:28AM PST until January 15 at 2:15PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 130 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor urban flooding as well as minor flooding in low-lying areas and poor drainage areas. There may be minor debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rain falling across the county. Hourly rainfall rates between 0.15 and 0.50 inches have been reported. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Lompoc, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Carpinteria, Solvang, Isla Vista, Los Alamos and Summerland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
